2:T827,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"FAQPage","mainEntity":[{"@type":"Question","name":"Do Peruvians need a visa for Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"No visa needed for 90 days. For longer stays, Mercosur associate residency gives you 2 years with full work rights. The process is streamlined compared to non-Mercosur countries."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"How big is the Peruvian community?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"One of the fastest-growing communities - 150,000 to 200,000 Peruvians live in Argentina, heavily concentrated in Buenos Aires. You'll find Peruvian restaurants, cultural events, and strong community support."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What kind of work do Peruvians do in Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Many work in gastronomy (Peruvian restaurants are extremely popular), healthcare (nurses, caregivers), construction, and services. There's also a growing professional class in IT and business."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Is the Peruvian Spanish accent understood in Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes, though distinct. Peruvian Spanish is clear and formal, which Argentines appreciate. You may be asked about your accent, but communication is easy. You'll quickly adapt to Argentine slang (lunfardo)."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Can I bring my family?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes, Mercosur associate residency extends to spouse and children. Family reunification is straightforward for Peruvians."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Will I lose my Peruvian citizenship?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"No, both countries allow dual citizenship. Many Peruvians maintain their Peruvian passport while acquiring Argentine nationality."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"How does cost of living compare to Lima?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Buenos Aires is generally 20-30% more expensive than Lima for rent and services, but salaries can be higher too. The exchange rate situation makes budgeting complex but manageable."}}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"{\"@context\":\"https://schema.org\",\"@type\":\"BreadcrumbList\",\"itemListElement\":[{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":1,\"name\":\"Home\",\"item\":\"https://expatsargentina.com\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":2,\"name\":\"Nationalities\",\"item\":\"https://expatsargentina.com/nationality\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":3,\"name\":\"Peru\"}]}"}}],["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen","children":[["$","section",null,{"className":"bg-gradient-to-b from-primary/10 to-background py-12 md:py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container px-4 md:px-6","children":[["$","nav",null,{"className":"flex items-center gap-2 text-sm text-muted-foreground mb-6","children":[["$","$L3",null,{"href":"/","className":"hover:text-foreground transition-colors","children":"Home"}],["$","span",null,{"children":"/"}],["$","$L3",null,{"href":"/nationality","className":"hover:text-foreground transition-colors","children":"Nationalities"}],["$","span",null,{"children":"/"}],["$","span",null,{"className":"text-foreground","children":"Peru"}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-4xl","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center gap-4 mb-4","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-6xl","children":"ðŸ‡µðŸ‡ª"}],["$","div",null,{"children":["$L4","$L5"]}]]}],"$L6","$L7"]}]]}]}],"$L8","$L9"]}]],null,"$La"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}
